subject: Sales
title: The Decoy Effect
description: Learn The Decoy Effect in one minute.

hook.text: Small popcorn is $3, large is $7. Nobody buys large. Add a medium at $6.50 and large sells out.

buildup.text: The decoy effect is a pricing trick that makes one option look better by adding a worse one nearby.

discovery.text: The medium exists only to make the large look like a steal. It was never meant to sell.

twist.text: The Economist used this exact trick. A useless middle option drove most readers to the premium.

climax.text: Humans don't judge value in isolation. We judge value by comparison with nearby options.

punchline.text: Add a bad option. The good one suddenly looks great.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of a 'decoy' product in pricing?
options: To make another option look better by comparison
